# UD Abaza ATB

Language: [Abaza](/abq/index.html) (code: `abq`)<br/>
Family: Northwest Caucasian

This treebank has been part of Universal Dependencies since the UD v2.11 release.

The following people have contributed to making this treebank part of UD: Alexey Koshevoy, Anastasia Panova, Ilya Makarchuk.

Repository: [UD_Abaza-ATB](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Abaza-ATB)<br />
Search this treebank on-line: [PML-TQ](https://lindat.mff.cuni.cz/services/pmltq/#!/treebank/udabq_atb212)<br />
Download all treebanks: [UD 2.12](/#download)

License: CC BY-SA 4.0

Genre: spoken

Questions, comments?
General annotation questions (either Abaza-specific or cross-linguistic) can be raised in the [main UD issue tracker](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/docs/issues).
You can report bugs in this treebank in the [treebank-specific issue tracker on Github](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Abaza-ATB/issues).
If you want to collaborate, please contact [alexeykochevoy&nbsp;(æt)&nbsp;gmail&nbsp;•&nbsp;com].
Development of the treebank happens directly in the UD repository, so you may submit bug fixes as pull requests against the dev branch.

## Description

UD_Abaza-ATB is a treebank based on [Spoken corpus of Abaza](http://lingconlab.ru/spoken_abaza/).



UD_Abaza-ATB is a treebank based on [Spoken corpus of Abaza](http://lingconlab.ru/spoken_abaza/). This corpus represents a compilation of spoken texts collected during field-trips to Inžič-Čukun village in Karachay-Cherkess Republic, Russia. Abaza is a highly polysynthetic language from the Northwest Caucasian family, and it is spoken by approximately 38.000 speakers in Russia.

## Acknowledgments

The authots are gratefull to Elena Sokur for creating and maintaing the Spoken corpus of Abaza. AK is also grateful to Niko Partanen and Thierry Poibeau for their help and supervision on the early stages of this project. The corpus was annotated by the participants of [Aspects of Abaza Grammar](https://ling.hse.ru/abazagrammar/project) group, so this treebank would not be possible without their work.

<h2>Tokenization and Word Segmentation</h2>


<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 98 sentences and 652 tokens.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>All tokens in this corpus are followed by a space.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain words with spaces.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain words that contain both letters and punctuation.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
</ul>

<h2>Morphology</h2>

<h3>Tags</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 13 UPOS tags out of 17 possible: <a>ADJ</a>, <a>ADP</a>, <a>ADV</a>, <a>AUX</a>, <a>CCONJ</a>, <a>DET</a>, <a>NOUN</a>, <a>NUM</a>, <a>PART</a>, <a>PRON</a>, <a>PROPN</a>, <a>SCONJ</a>, <a>VERB</a></li>
<li>This corpus does not use the following tags: INTJ, SYM, PUNCT, X</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 7 word types tagged as particles (PART): ауи, вот, дына, дыната, йгьи, хIва, щта</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 22 lemmas tagged as pronouns (PRON): анахь, араса, арат, араъа, ари, ауат, ауаъа, ауи, ауыла, дара, заджвгьи, закIгьи, закIы, зымгIва, йара, лара, псори, са, сара, уара, хIара, швара</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 7 lemmas tagged as determiners (DET): абари, ари, ауат, ауахьауат, ауи, зымгIва, сара</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Out of the above, 5 lemmas occurred sometimes as PRON and sometimes as DET: ари, ауат, ауи, зымгIва, сара</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 2 lemmas tagged as auxiliaries (AUX): _, чпара</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Out of the above, 2 lemmas occurred sometimes as AUX and sometimes as VERB: _, чпара</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>There are 3 <a href="../feat/VerbForm.html">(de)verbal forms:</a></li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>Conv

      <li>Erg
        <ul>
          <li>VERB-NonFin: сазрыпхьарыз</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
      <li>Io
        <ul>
          <li>VERB-NonFin: зквшвауала, злачважвауа, змакву</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
      <li>Loc
        <ul>
          <li>VERB-NonFin: йъатаз, съадзапхьузгьи, съацаз</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
      <li>Mnr
        <ul>
          <li>VERB-Conv: йшйымахымзымцара</li>
          <li>VERB-NonFin: йшыъу, шабгаз, йшангIалуа, йшгIахъсрышвтуа, йшсчпауа, йшутахъу, йышнаргуаз, сшарыпхьагIвхаз, шпацуш</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
      <li>Pr
        <ul>
          <li>VERB-NonFin: зкъвырману</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
      <li>Rsn
        <ul>
          <li>VERB-NonFin: йзылгвалищд</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
      <li>Tmp
        <ul>
          <li>VERB: ансызгIалгыз, дангIайх, йанукIвхIара, нихIва, сангIалга, сангIалгагьи, санхвыцыз, санца</li>
          <li>VERB-NonFin: ансызгIалгыз, дангIайх, йанукIвхIара, нихIва, сангIалга, санхвыцыз, санца</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<h2>Syntax</h2>

<h3>Auxiliary Verbs and Copula</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 1 lemmas as copulas (<a>cop</a>). Examples: _.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain auxiliaries.</li>
</ul>

<h3>Core Arguments, Oblique Arguments and Adjuncts</h3>

Here we consider only relations between verbs (parent) and nouns or pronouns (child).
<ul>
  <li><a>nsubj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB--NOUN (4)</li>
      <li>VERB--PRON (4)</li>
      <li>VERB-Conv--NOUN (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN (30)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON (20)</li>
      <li>VERB-NonFin--NOUN (7)</li>
      <li>VERB-NonFin--PRON (10)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>obj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB--NOUN (9)</li>
      <li>VERB--PRON (2)</li>
      <li>VERB-Conv--NOUN (3)</li>
      <li>VERB-Conv--PRON (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN (34)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON (13)</li>
      <li>VERB-NonFin--NOUN (4)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>iobj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB--NOUN (1)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN (5)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--PRON (2)</li>
      <li>VERB-NonFin--NOUN (4)</li>
      <li>VERB-NonFin--PRON (2)</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>




<h3>Relations Overview</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 1 relation subtypes: <a>dep:repeat</a></li>
<li>The following 1 main types are not used alone, they are always subtyped: <a>dep</a></li>
<li>The following 9 relation types are not used in this corpus at all: <a>expl</a>, <a>aux</a>, <a>appos</a>, <a>clf</a>, <a>compound</a>, <a>list</a>, <a>orphan</a>, <a>goeswith</a>, <a>punct</a></li>
</ul>
